response.overview: Mary has always been a loving mother. When left alone to care for her mother-in-law and 10-year old son, the lines between a caregiver and a mother are blurred. In their home, Mary washes their clothes, hangs them, and folds them. Nanay Ditas, diagnosed with Alzheimerâ€™s disease, struggles with her memory lapses, mood changes, and personality shifts. Mary tries to find a path towards healing through the sacredness of doing laundry.
response.title: Lugud
